m_DescList: A piece of text often has a beginning and an end.
Use <color=#FF68DD>\A</color> or <color=#FF68DD>^</color> to represent the beginning of a string.
For instance, using <color=#FF68DD>\A</color><color=#AB2800>0</color> to match the examples (i.e., "match content starting with 0"):
Use <color=#FF68DD>\Z</color> or <color=#FF68DD>$</color> to represent the end of a string.
For instance, using <color=#AB2800>1</color><color=#FF68DD>\Z</color> to match the examples (i.e., "match content ending with 1"):
Now, we need to match all strings that contain only the digit "1".
Please construct a regular expression that passes all the tests on the right.
